title: 12-Year-Old Iowa Girl Killed In Hunting Accident
content:
An investigation is still being conducted into a fatal hunting incident that claimed the life of a 12-year-old girl. It happened Saturday morning, Dec. 27, 2014 in Tama County. The Department of Natural Resources and the Tama County Sheriff’s Department responded to the call at about 7:40 a.m. along Ridge Road, west of the town of Traer.
Liesel Casto, 12, of Traer, died after being struck by a bullet from a muzzleloader rifle, as she was preparing to hunt with others.
The DNR says her death is the first hunting fatality reported in Iowa during the 2014 seasons.
